alert.note: Alert for Sandoval (New Mexico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albuquerque (Northern and Central New Mexico)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued June 17 at 6:01PM MDT by NWS Albuquerque
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 9 PM MDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Arroyo and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected over portions of Sandoval county. * WHERE...A portion Sandoval county in north central New Mexico, including areas between Cuba and the Jemez Pueblo. * WHEN...Until 900 PM MDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in arroyos, creeks, low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 601 PM MDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. This will cause arroyo and small stream flooding. Between 0.5 and 1.5 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts of 0.25 to 0.75 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... San Ysidro, Canones in Rio Arriba County, Jemez Pueblo, Canon and Ponderosa. - This includes the following recreation areas... Vista Linda Campground. This includes the following highways... Highway 550 between Mile Markers 34 and 61.
info.instruction: Arroyos, streams, and normally dry rivers can become raging killer currents in a matter of minutes. Water in arroyos can travel many miles and take hours to reach your location from upstream rain areas.
